intro: Sisymbrella boissieri, commonly known as the rock scabious, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, and its hairy, glandular leaves. It typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in mountainous areas. Sisymbrella boissieri is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is adapted to arid environments.
